"I guess you're right. So what should we do?" You ask.

"Well, we're each other, we need to act like each other a bit more. That's why you get my purse because you're me right now. I also think we shouldn't do any drastic changes in appearance, in other words, you need to dress like me and I'll do the same. Regretfully, we have no idea how this happened or know a way back, so I think we should get used to calling each other by each others names. So, I'm going to call you Betty every time, all the time unless you tell me not to and you call me Victoria every time, all the time, O.K.?" She elaborates more as you both head towards the buses.

"Alright..." You sigh with a drooping head, your eyes focused on your dark attire that perhaps you may grow sick of.

"Alright what?" She asks with a stomp of her foot and a goofy smile.

"Alright, V--Victoria." You say in defeat.

"Don't worry, hopefully this will end soon enough but we'll just have to get used to this for now, Betty." She reassures you but points you in a direction you had no intention on going. "What?" you ask instinctively.

"Isn't your bus that way Betty?" She chuckles. You realize soon enough what she means and once again sigh. "I guess there is no choice, I can't really walk into my house as you and live there. Oh well, I like your house anyways." You say. She nods in agreement and runs off towards your bus.

You climb aboard your new temporary bus and take a seat near the back, only a few acquaintances making up the cabinet of people.

"Hey Betty." Says quite a people on the bus which only leads you to smile awkwardly. "I guess they are more than acquaintances now... hah..." You joke as you contort your head away from them for a moment.

"Hey." You say. A lot of them seem to be underclassmen, a few you have talked to when you have taken Betty's bus to her house before but in no way formed a legitimate conversation. Speaking of her, you hear a buzz from your now dark purse and take out Betty's Cellphone which has a text from her saying...

"Tell the spiky haired kid that you'll let him grope your breasts for 20$, I bet he gives you 20 bucks." You are shocked by what Betty is suggesting, more so on why she would want you to do such a thing, especially with her body.

"WHAT!?" You text back.

"Just do it. He's a rich kid and a little too hormonally driven." Betty texts back.

"I don't want some random kid touching my brea-- THESE AREN'T EVEN MINE!" You text back with an increased ferocity in your press.

"Just do it. I give you permission." Is the reply. You take a deep breath and decide to do it just to see why she wants you to do it so bad. "H--hey kid." You say. He turns around with a grin on his face already which makes you distance yourself a bit. "I'll umm... g--give me 20 bucks and I'll let you grope my breasts." You say, resisting all urges to cover your face in shame.

"Betty! Don't tempt me again!" He says, lifting himself out of his seat to sit next to you. He hands you a 20 which you take in discouragement.

"Hey guys, Brad is going to try and touch Betty's breasts again."

"He never really does it, he's a wimp but still pays money to try!"

You feel a bit relieved from the commentary of the others but feel a small finger press against the side of your chest for only a moment, looking back to see the kid already hiding in his seat. "What kind of weird bus is this...?" You whisper to yourself.

"He only poked it didn't he?" Is the next text you get from Betty.

"Geeze Betty, How much money have you gotten off of him for that? You're on your way to being a hooker." A kid with glasses says to you.

"W-what!? I am not a hooker nor will I ever be!" You retort. Ironically finding the situation fun, despite it being something you wouldn't normally find yourself doing.

"Yeah, he did only touch it. How bizarre is your bus?" You text back to Betty.

"Betty, it's your stop!" A kid shouts. You jump to your feet and scurry off the bus to the front door of your new temporary home.

1242212211.content:
The small breeze wraps itself around your legs, gently fanning your skirt. You grab the handle to the large white door and inhale deeply. You open the door as you exhale and walk into Betty's home. Not since having first set foot in her home have you been this nervous entering her home.

You pop your shoes off and head into the kitchen, finding the lack of communication stellar in it's refinement. It only takes a few more steps to find Betty's mother Rachel on the coach watching T.V. "Oh, hi Betty." She says with only a quick glance. You were expecting to be in a more awkward situation and feel almost disappointed from the lack of attention. "Umm... Hey Mom." You respond.

"How was school?" She asks, placing herself slightly upright. "Interesting." You reply but she merely responds with "Good."

Disappointed by the attention you turn around and follow along the wall to the staircase. You walk up the stairs, sifting your hands along the polished rails. You pass Betty's room and head into the bathroom for some much needed relief. "Seems I was tense for nothing." you say to your reflection before sitting down on the chilly plates of the toilet. You take another deep breath to try and relax; heightening your posture. A calm expression being worn, you continually stare at your reflection in the mirror, the droplets of urine doing little to affect your long stare. Betty's parted bangs falling short above your eye, furthered bangs falling gently to your cheeks, the back of her hair falling just barely to the bottom of your neck. Your thin eyes now rising from your high cheeks, giving the illusion as if they arced upwards in the same powerful and beautiful way that Betty's always looked. You place two fingers to your forehead and close your eyes in thought.

"I need to stop falling into a trance every time I see my reflection." you say as you clean yourself up.

Entering Betty's room you place Betty's purse down at her desk and take a seat on her bed. You have been in her room thousands of times but never viewed it as your own until now. You walked up to her closet and opened it up to find quite a lot of clothes to choose from, more than you remember her having. A lot of them not even in dark colors despite Betty preferring to wear dark. You siphon through them for a few minutes before sitting down on her desk chair.

Feeling a bit bored, you turn her computer on. The moment it boots up you feel as if you're invading her privacy, more so does that feeling incur when you see the display name "Betty" on the MSN window which started and logged in on it's own. Curiosity getting the best of you, you go to Myspace.com only to see that as you assumed, you're auto-signed in as Betty. "I don't like this one bit." You say. A few messages pop up from people you don't know and as such you ignore them. "Maybe I'll just not use her computer..." You suggest to yourself.

The door rumbles for a moment before opening to reveal Betty's little brother Mathew. He's 7 years old you think, has short blonde hair and is usually quite energetic-- as boys often are. "Bethy! Can you help me with my school stuffs?" He asks. You'd seldom disagree to help a child so you agree. Quite the opposite of what you assumed, you find yourself building some sort of diorama of pilgrims.

Happy to say you helped finish it, you prepare to leave Mathew's room, gratified to help your little brother. 'I've never had a little anything before. It's cool.' you think with a smile. Before exiting, your new mother calls you down to dinner along with Mathew.

Curious about the absence of Betty's father you bring it up to his wife. "So umm... where's dad?"

She does little to bottle up her anger as she stabs a fork into the steak. "Who knows!" She roars. Regretting bringing it up, you sink your head down and just continue to eat.

After dinner your offer to help clean up is surprisingly taken in by Betty's mother but she declines your offer regardless. "I guess Betty doesn't clean up much." You say as you head back upstairs.

Knowing that you have a responsibility to uphold, you do Betty's homework to the best of your abilities. You wonder if she would of even done it if this didn't happen, as she often "forgets." On a similar note you wonder if Betty plans on doing your homework. Keeping with the advice from Betty about acting like each other, you call her up to remind her to do it.

"Be-- Victoria?" You say as the ringing ceases.

"Hey Betty. What's up?" She says.

"Nothing really-- hey, I was wondering if you have done my homework." You say, a disgruntled "Errr..." heard from the other side.

"Was I supposed to?" She asks in a jest.

"Come on Betty! I mean... Victoria! You're the one who said to be like each other. I always do my homework since I always do so poor on tests, I need the score from 100% homework." You whine at her. She seems despondent about your guilty way of making her actually do homework.

"Fine! I'll do it but you have to at least do min--"

"I finished yours." You say in snobbish superiority.

"Tsh... Fine! Fine! I'll do it now, bye." She grumbles.

You hang up the phone with glee from your successful attempt at getting her to do your homework. You outstretch your arms and yawn, deciding that an early sleep might be a good idea.

12422122112.content:
You awake the next morning, rested up to the highest degree. The second thought of why you are in Betty's room only lasts for a moment as you swiftly recall the unreal events of yesterday. You stretch with a smile, delighted with how satisfying your sleep was. Jumping out of bed you head over to Betty's closet to find something to wear for the day. Motioning for a nice imitation you pick out a dark green, knee length skirt and a brown top with a open black denim vest to go over it.

You walk out of the room towards the bathroom, finding that the house is still quiet; the lack of opened doors indicating that you are the first to rise. You undress with little enthusiasm, averting your eyes away from Betty's naked body.

The water does good for diverting your attention away from the fact you are in-fact washing Betty's body. Regardless, you do find yourself forced to examine Betty's naked exterior from first person. As expected, you are overall impressed with her figure, you feel the only aspect about you that one ups her is your superior breast size.

You finish up, burdened very little at styling Betty's hair as you have helped her do so on many occasions-- though the altered perspective does prove to be more of a challenge. Your stomach begins to rumble as you finish up examining all angles of Betty's face to insure your success in making her look like herself.

Normally used to your mother making you breakfast, you are a bit shaken to make yourself something at this early in the morning. "I guess her mom doesn't get up until she has to get Mathew to school." You assume as you gobble down some toast, snagging the small amount of money placed on the counter which you can only assume is for lunch.

The bus arrives shortly; a place of distant desire in your mind. The spiky haired boy is indeed present and seems to be gazing at your chest as you walk down the isle. Resisting any urges to scold him or cover your chest, you walk in stride to your seat near the back. The underclassmen seem to do little to force conversation on you unless you present yourself which at least makes the bus ride tolerable.

As you walk into school you look about for Betty. Your eyes lock on her once you spot her; she is walking casually in this direction. Her attire is very similar to yesterday, replacing the jeans with a pink skirt, perhaps relishing in the fact bright colors now suit her. Blond locks, parting dead center with bangs that tower high before falling by her cheeks, the same slight waves being present. "Hey Betty." She says with a glimmering smile.

"Hey." You reply, purposely leaving out her name-- as it would be your own, a continually awkward assignment to follow.

"You did a good job maintaining my image." She says. You nod and say "Likewise."

A few steps together you wonder about your request last night and can't help but ask. "Did you do my homework?"

"Yes... it was boring!" She cries out in recollection of doing it. "At least I got to enjoy a nice breakfast this morning." She gloats, a smirk taken on her face as she stares at you, relishing in the knowledge that you didn't get one.

"Yeah, yeah!" You reply. As you walk around the halls, you wonder if you should discuss with Betty about how this happened, you are curious to know. That thought quickly dissipates as Robert comes into your sight.

"Hey look, it's Robert." Betty says-- as if you didn't know already. "S--should I go talk to him?" You ask but look down at yourself in dismay as you realize your current state. "Oh crap-- I can't go like this! Y--you go!" You cry in a demanding maneuver. Betty looks hesitant but quickly agrees, under the condition that you come as well. You both place yourselves behind Robert, who is placing and displacing a few books in his locker.

"Hey Robert." Betty says. Robert turns a bit, a bright smile taking form on his face as he looks at Betty. "Hey Victoria, hey Betty." He says.

"Feeling any better since yesterday?" Betty chimes as she places an arm around Robert in a friendly way that you can't even imagine doing so non-challant. You notice Robert's face is distorted and a quick grin goes across his face. "Y--yeah. Thanks for umm... the uhh.. concern." He stutters out as he puts his back to his locker, shielding his shoulder from Betty's grasp.

"So how are you two doing?" He asks.

"Great!" Betty says with a smile, from a outside perspective, you can clearly see that Robert may indeed have feelings for you.

"Uhh, fine." You say, your attention more focused on the third person perspective on yours and Robert's conversation.

"We have class together first today right?" Betty asks Robert.

"Yeah, Gym." He replies.

"Cool, I could use a good run and..." Betty says, your mind merely drifts out as you listen to them talk so casually. Part of you is so envious of Betty, you wish you could talk so naturally to Robert another part wishes Betty had to deal with the same shy and nervous personality traits that you get stuck with so often around Robert. You smile to yourself in disappointment as you feel no increase in confidence while Betty continues to speak as casually as ever to Robert. More so than that, they have walked off to class together, leaving you in the dust.

You sigh and begin your way towards your first class of the day. The small bit of anger and jealously fade fast as you realize this is what you asked of Betty in the first place.

You enter the classroom for English, speedily are you brought face to face with Josh Hampton. "Hey." He says, sounding very assertive.

"Umm, hi." You stutter, a bit out of place by the sudden conversation.

"What do you see in that kid?" He asks suddenly. The unsharpened question makes you stumble on coming up with an answer. "See in who...?" You inevitably ask.

"The way you acted yesterday-- you have feelings for that Robert kid, how come?" He asks once more, carrying a bit of information over this time. While you realize you, yourself have feelings for Robert, you can't go saying that you do when you're Betty. "Umm, sorry but I really don't have feel---" You start but he quickly calls you a liar.

"I really don't." You spout once more. He shrugs it off and with his tall stature and big appearance, towers over you, placing himself near your ear. "Well none of that really matters anyways. Look... umm-- well, you're Vic's best friend right?" He asks. You nod and say "Yes." despite it being technically incorrect.

"Have any advice on well-- how to ask her out?" He whispers. You jettison away from him with a spastic jump and a demented expression on your face. "Y-y-you like m-- Victoria?" You whisper back, despite the greater distance.

"Yeah." He says, looking away while scratching his cheek. You are pleased to hear the teacher say class is starting and part ways with Josh, even if only by a few feet and a class obligation to stay quiet.

You lay your head in your hands and wonder what to do.

"Ok... I'm Betty right now so-- do I want to go out with Josh? Do I want to help him ask the fake me out? What about Robert... but Josh is kind of hot-- really hot... but I know little about him. Argh...I should say no, I really should." You argue to yourself in unspoken pulses of your lips.

The class is fairly quiet so you take out your cellphone and begin texting Betty.

"Betty! Josh just asked me-- as you if you-- ok..."
"Josh asked me for help on how to ask you as me out. What do I do?"

You send both texts and await responses. It takes a few minutes but sure enough Betty does respond.

"What? He asked me out or you? I'm confused." It reads. Frustrated but understanding you resend a message with a better description.

"Oh. That's tough. You have been waiting for--"
"Robert for awhile but Josh is hot but who kno--
"knows how much he likes you. I'm not sure--"
"who to pick." She texts in 4 separate messages. The lack of advice or opinion really irks you as you ravage your hair in confusion.

"Well...I'll ___________________"

While the constant calls of "Betty." and the few opportunities to communicate with people that normally hate you but like you now that you are Betty is interesting, nothing of particular interest really goes on during the day.

Quickly grabbing your tray and fairly disgusting school provisions, you sit down with Betty at a secure table. To your surprise but unfortunate delight, Robert is sitting at the table as well. "H--hey Robert." You say.

"Hi Betty." He replies. You grab Betty close and whisper into her ear. "W--why today? I needed to talk to you in private about something." You stream into her ear.

"Sorry, I thought you wanted me to get close to him. I've been talking to him a lot today." She responds. You know full well that is what you want but you can't discuss what you desire with Robert around.

"I do but... not now, I need to talk to you." You say.

"Then tell him to leave, I'm not doing it." She replies with a smirk. You take a deep breath and turns towards Robert, who looks a bit distant because the two of you are whispering. "Robert, on any other day I'd love for you to sit with us but today I really need to talk to Victoria about something... important. Please don't think I don't like you-- please sit with us on any oth--" You go on a tangent of quick talking and apologies but Robert eventually interrupts you.

"Heh heh, Betty it's fine. I understand, I'll sit here tomorrow. See ya." He says as he leaves the table, going back to his normal group of friends.

"I feel horrible for that..." You say with your body outstretched on the table.

"I always find your nervous speed talking fun." Betty teases with a laugh. You give her a glare for only a moment but it quickly turns to a agreeable sigh.

"So what did you want to talk about? Did you pick Josh now or what? You got choices girl-- lucky thing." She says. You sit back up in your chair and take a sip of your milk before replying. "I told Josh that I didn't have feelings for him. He didn't look too upset but I felt like he was just hiding it. I felt bad."

Betty puts a hand on your shoulder and smiles. "Don't worry about it, it's for his own good." She reassures you.

"Thanks-- but anyways. All these third person relationship things got me thinking, we haven't discussed at all about how we switched bodies." You say. Betty folds her arms in thought for a moment before responding to your concern.

"Well, I honestly don't know what to think of it. It was about this time, you ran after Robert but stopped once you got outside the Cafeteria. I lectured you on your cold feet and why you should go after him-- next thing I knew I was staring at myself. Really not much evidence on how it happened from my perspective, what about you?" She explains. Your hand moves to your now short hair once more, sliding through the smooth placements of hair.

"Hmm, it's about the same for me. Let's see..." You begin, recalling back as best you can to that moment.

The memories dance around in your mind, the small clue hidden behind a crowd of twirling images. You claw at your scalp in frustration as no amount of remembrance resurfaces your spontaneous request. "It's the same thing. You were lecturing me and then the next thing I know I have my hand on my hip staring at myself." You say in shame despite of being unable to provide any wisdom. Betty merely folds her arms loosely at her waist and recedes to the back of her chair. "Well that doesn't help. Seems we have no clues at all." She says.

"There has to be something!" You spit back at her. She curls her lip and thinks for a moment before blurting out. "Not that I can think of!"

You press your hand into the table and thrash back once more. "This can't just happen out of the blue-- maybe someone did this to us somehow."

Betty just smirks at your insight. "Who would want to switch us around? No one~" Replying in a sing-song debunking of your idea. You fold your arms and grumble at Betty's unhelpful teasing.

"Well we need to find a way back. This kind of thing-- while interesting, can't be permanent." You poke back once again.

"I'm fine with finding a way back... but how do you suggest we start? It's not everyday that people switch bodies." She responds, looking actually a bit concerned.

"I don't know." You sigh. You feel a hand on your shoulder and a bright smile in your vision. "Well, let's just take it one step at a time. I feel a bit bizarre being you but it's a good kind of bizarre-- I know you're disliking your position as me so I'll definitely help thinking of ways to switch back." She explains. You know what she said is false and fight back. "I--I don't dislike being you.. I just don't want t-- well, it's hard to be myself like this." You cry out in a somber whimper.

"Well, we can think of this as permanent if you want. You can go out with boys as me if you want to--" She begins but you jab at her proposal very quickly. "No! I don't want to think this is permanent. It's only been a day, it's way too soon to give up."

"Alright, let's just continue as is. Should we meet up after school for idea planning on how to swap back?" She asks. You nod. Betty seems a bit displeased with you for whatever reason suddenly-- her small hands soon clamping both your cheeks in a forced smile.

"Stop frowning! Make my pearly whites shine!" She demands in a amusing display. "L--Leegoo!" You squirm out, her hands ceasing to grasp you, a relieved bit of laughter escaping your lips.

Despite the obvious being obvious, a few girls laugh at your reaction. "What do you want Sharon?" You ask. "For your pee-sized breasts to be covered by a shirt and a correct sized bra, finish changing you disgusting slut." She jolts, her hands waving in your direction. You are once more aware that Betty's body in no way has pee-sized breasts-- triple B, a few sizes smaller than your own. Regretfully you become irritated and place the white baggy T-shirt over your head.

She smirks at your obvious discomfort and turns around in satisfaction, her motion carrying her long pale brown hair gracefully. You find her tight short blue shorts and similarly tight white T-shit a sure sign that she has no intention of playing with much enthusiasm and is more worried about her appearance.

Irked in composure you...

You wish that Sharon would have a bit of a mental makeover. Melissa being a very quiet, reserved but easily flustered girl, her mentality is the first in your mind as a living representation of how you want Sharon to act.

Your frustration later dies as you head out to the gymnasium towards the rest of the class.

"Hey Betty." Someone says, a shifting eye revealing Tim.

"Hey." You reply. You both follow the teachers commands for stretches. Your eyes drift to Sharon for whatever reason, noticing she is continually tugging on her short shorts and tight T-shirt with a disconcerting look on her face. You chuckle at the sight as it seems to appear like she is embarrassed, an out of place feeling for her.

You play basketball throughout Gym, continually making small talk with Tim as he often approaches you to speak. You feel as if you're making Betty look nonathletic with your poor display of physical prowess but at the very least no one takes notice. Sharon, whom you have been looking at fairly often for some reason today, is playing in spurts of enthusiasm unlike her usual approach of walking casually along the court. You never knew why but she leaves all her physical abilities to her volleyball and cheer leading practice.

You get in and out of the locker room with minimal interference from Sharon who now seems uninterested in communicating with you or her friends. Once back in the gym, Tim approaches you fairly quickly; an unusual grasp of your hand taking place. You follow him as he leads you to the uncrowded area of the Gym. "Umm...what is it?" You ask. He looks away for a moment, his face taking the color of an apple.

"Betty? Would you go out with me?" He cowers out between his shaking hands and dislocating eyes. You wish that you had dreamed that but his face remains stern, awaiting an answer. You scratch your head in confusion. "Umm... C--can I have time to think about it?" You ask of him. He seems hurt already by your lack of enthusiasm towards his request. "Sure, you can think about it as long as you want." He assures you.

"Thanks. I--I'll see you later then." You reply before walking passed him with your head down. The bell rings as you head to the exit. Free of Tim's sight, you increase your pace towards your next class to discuss the current situation with Betty. 'Why now? Why are people asking people out so much today!? It was even my first time being asked out... well, directly.' you scream in your head.

Delighted to see the fake blond seated in your seat on time for class you tap her back in enthusiasm. "Hey." You say. She responds with a smile and a response. "Hey." You rudely take the seat in-front of her for the time being and place your face close to her. "We got problems. Tim asked me-- well technically you out." You tell her. "I barely even know him. He's not really my type-- kind of amazed he'd ask me out, I'm usually kind of rude to him." She answers. You find it appropriate and respond in agreement to her choice. "Alright, that's fine but why-- why do I have to tell two people in one day that I'm not interested in them!?" You cry out in dismay to your unlucky position between all the eager chains of relationships. Betty wears a bright smile and brushes her pretty blond hair. "That's just your luck, Betty" She teases. You wear a sour lip and glare at her but she merely laughs at you.

"Umm... can I have my seat?" A young boy asks, who you don't seem to recall the name for despite him sitting in front of you-- well when you were yourself.

"Sure, I'm sorry." You respond. Bowing your head in a apologetic fashion, dispersing yourself to your seat, opposite your normal position.

The class drifts by as a faded memory. You bid adieus to Betty and head towards your last class-- History. About now you realize how annoying it is to have an early lunch wave, yesterday's later wave made the day seem much shorter.

You enter the classroom, taken off guard by Robert's presence despite knowing he is in this class with you. Your seat directly behind his which you take in an eager hop. "Hey Robert." You say. He turns with a smile and greets you as well. "Hey Betty."

"How are you?" The generic continuation enough to make you smile with satisfaction. "Fine, you?" He says.

"Good." You reply. The basics gone, you find yourself a bit somber that you have no conversation left to pursue-- at least that comes to mind. He returns to his normal position; you lean back in your chair in thought on what to say. Part of you wonders if you should abuse your position as Betty and ask Robert something personal about yourself.

Trying hard to act like Betty you lean forward in your chair and quietly ask "So... when do you plan to ask out Victoria?" Robert's posture straightens and he turns to you with a faulty grin. You swallow your pride and continue your charade as Betty. "W--well, you like her don't you?" You ask of him. He stalls for time with uneasy to appeal hands and the repetitive stuttering of a sentence. "I uhh..."

"She...likes you." You tell him. Awed by your confession you almost cover your face in disbelief. Robert feeling a similar taste of awe is looking at you with a similar expression. "Really!?" He blurts out. You nod slowly and look at the small speck on the tiled floor; desperate for something other than Robert to look at out of stress. "Yeah, she is just waiting for you to ask her out. So... get on that..." You say, exceedingly quiet with the furthered demand. You feel like crying at the moment. The inability to tell Robert how you feel until now-- with a voice that isn't yours.

"Thank you Betty. I've had feelings for Victoria for... a long time. I had no idea she felt the same. I'll ask her out soon then." He says. You smile as he reveals his feelings for you.

"I know this is a dumb thing to ask her best friend but... do you know where I should take her out to?" He asks. You fiddle your fingers in and out, the speed at which they move a clear indicator of your emotional state.

"A--anywhere is fine. I'm sure she'll love it regardless." You tell him. He seems happy to hear that and thanks you once again. The conversation finally dies and you lay your head into your arms as you place them onto the desk. A few tears escaping in a confusing mess of emotions.

You proceed through the class and vacate the school as quickly as you can, leaving Betty uninformed that she may or not be asked out by Robert. You place yourself in your bed, relieved to be out of school for the weekend. "It's fine, all I did was push Robert to go out with me. Only problem is... the me he is going to ask out isn't me." You punish yourself, beating yourself in the head repeatably for ever abusing your position as Betty. You feel nothing but remorse for knowing that you may very well not get to go on your own first date.

"M--maybe he won't ask me out for a few days. Maybe I have time to find a way to switch back." You chime in a desperate attempt to grasp hope. The small hum emitting from Betty's fan broken by her cellphone song. You answer it, finding Betty on the other line.

"Hey-- are you O.K.? You seemed kind of down after school and weren't we supposed to meet up and think of ways to go back to normal?" She says. You recall saying that you should meet up and apologize for blowing her off.

"Well, where would we start?" You ask, ringing exceptionally apathetic.

"Grrr, stop being depressed-- screw finding a way back today. We have light left, let's go have some fun or something!" She screams out.

12422122112212111.content:
"I guess so. Where are we going?" You reply.

"Anything is fine with me-- being the head of the swim team, maybe we should go for a dip? It's a nice day out." She suggests. You think it's a good idea and decide to go with it. You agree to meet her at the school's swimming pool in several minutes.

You stuff Betty's black two piece into her backpack and run down the stairs, giving only a simple wave to your current blood mother. You hop on Betty's bike and try your best to maintain a good speed to the pool. You see Betty waving you in as you cut the last corner to the school. "Heeey~" She shouts.

You park your bike inside the school grounds to repel thieves and head to the changing rooms. You feel a bit awkward as you walk out, revealing so much of a body you're not used to. You find it continually odd that you still feel nervous about such things when you know how good Betty looks.

You scoff at Betty who is wearing your school's swim team one piece. She smiles with superiority, both hands parallel at her hips. "I'm the head of the swim team now!" She jests. You push her to the pool, revealing 3 members of your swim team and a few other students.

"Victoria! Bullet your way through the water!" Jessica Hutchinson shouts. She is a quick girl in the pool and one of the best on your team, far as appearance goes she is a bit lacking in her figure but she has a cute face. You grin at Betty as she takes in all the undeserved fame of being the so-called head of the swimming team. She waves her hand and rubs the back of her thighs with a twinkling smile of both enjoyment and embarrassment. "I can't really go fast today, my thighs are throbbing from a long run I took. I'm just here to relax." She replies, feigning false exhaustion or perhaps not.

"Did you really go for a run?" You ask in a sly, inspecting manner.

"A little one...hehe." She replies with a grin. You stretch your arms and run towards the pool, jumping into a smooth dive. The lovely feeling of water around you makes you smile as you careen through it. You have always enjoying the water and swimming is one of the few athletic talents you excel at; while Betty is usually energetic and is good at most. You kick off the other end of the pool and swim back to the other side. A part of you feeling as if you're going faster than you have ever gone before. The feeling is brought more to your mind as you reach the end and come to an alert halt. The shouts about your speed and agility finally getting to your ears.

"Wooow! That's amazing Betty! You're just as fast as Victoria-- maybe faster! Why haven't you joined the swim team!?" Jessica screams out in compliments. You can't resist smiling as you get out of the water, sitting at the pool's rim. "Was it really that fast?" You ask. Betty assures you that she has never seen you go quite that fast before.

"Wait wait, Betty. Let me time you." Jessica demand as she scurries off to get her phone. Eager to actually know your time you agree and go when she tells you to. The second time feels even better as you feel yourself pulling more fluently than you ever had before. Jessica erupts in jumps of joy as you reach the end shouting that you beat "Victoria's" time by 2 seconds, which is a lot.

"R--really!?" You bounce back at her. She nods in hype and shows you the time on her phone. You can't help but feel amazed that you beat your old time by so much.

"Beeeetty! Join the team!" She begs of you. You paw your face and smile. "I'll think about it." You reply. You get up and close the distance between Betty and yourself. "Do you workout or something?" You ask. Betty places a hand on her hip and glances up in a trance. "Umm.. I go for runs a lot but I don't really go to the gym or anything." She answers. You wipe some of your diluted brown hair out of your face and say "Not sure why but I felt a lot lighter than normal."

"Maybe it's because you don't have these." She spouts as she gropes your breasts or her's perhaps as they are currently attached to her. You jab your hand at her and call foul on her assumptions. "No way! Your breasts are only a couple sizes smaller than mine and you're only like 3 inches shorter than me." You debate to her but she merely smirks with delight. "3 inches less water resistance and 2 sizes more weight." She jokes which you take too far by pushing her into the pool. She resurfaces, her full bangs now falling almost flat to her face, her beautiful blond color now diluted to a color she may find more reminiscent. Little other descriptions are given time as you are pulled into the water, laughing upon the retrieval of oxygen.



The next day you wake up, eager to go out with Betty once more to have some more fun and perhaps look into the switching issue. You call her up and she tells you she is...

You are shocked to know that Robert finally asked you out but are only brought into dismay when you realize you aren't yourself right now.

"Oh." Is all you respond with.

"Sorry. I figured you wanted me to say yes, so now I have a date with him today." She tells you with a significantly dampened tone, perhaps feeling guilty about doing something so personal for you. Feeling sympathy for Betty's feelings you ignore your own with a peppy retort. "Oh, thank you Betty! I don't mind. I want to go out with Robert even if I'm not myself right now so please go for me."

"Alright! You can count on me to make you completely irresistible." She shouts back, full of nervous hysteria. The line soon fades to a dial as she hangs up somewhat abruptly. You can't help but feel irritated from your own absence to your first date. You lay down on the bed, head resting in your hands as you stare blankly at the ceiling. "This sucks!" You erupt as you rise to a seat, for once making full use of Betty's energetic resonance.

You end up pacing about Betty's room in a tampered emotion, a modest scowl written on your face. Nails ravage your head as you claw at your scalp. "Aaargh! How am I supposed to be O.K. with this!?" You shout. The door to your room soon opens by a curious father whom you have only recently gotten acquainted with; at least while wearing Betty's character.

"Something wrong, honey?" He asks as he enters the room, a bit bashful to his own daughter. You have honestly never seen much of Betty's father as he often works late but from your meeting of him today it seems like he is quite nice-- at least towards his daughter.

"Umm... Yes but it's too hard to explain. I'll figure it out myself, thanks for caring though-- uhm.. Daddy." You reply with an easy smile. He seems quite delighted by your respond for whatever reason and smiles as he shifts his glasses. "I see. Well if you need anything, let me know O.K.?" He informs you. You nod with a bright smile and chime "O.K.!" He gently closes the door on exit, still wearing a whole-hearted smile.

"He seems like a nice father." You assure yourself.

Your mind soon wanders back to the issue at hand and once more you need to decide what to do.

They both say in similar ways, perhaps from being best friends for so long.

"We'll see..." Cindy says in quite the monotone; a hand tugging lightly on her dark green sweatshirt. You merely glance back and forth between the two as they exchange conversation about things you have little interest in unfortunately. You find that Cindy's calm and conservative nature is a great balance for Andrea's rather childish set of energy.

The light colored skirt with floral imprints you find a bit too childish to ever wear yourself but when you look at Andrea a bit more you do find that it may in-fact look good on her. You both wait for Andrea to change into it, taking seats on a near-by bench. You sigh in dismay as the thoughts come back to you once more but you shake them off. You notice Cindy eying you but only turns away when you look at her. You rest your head in your hands, Betty's soft hair placing itself loosely around your fingers. "I can't even pretend to be interested in this right now..." You whisper to yourself. "Hmph, Betty is a wonderful girl but I guess you wouldn't realize that unless you were in the same situation as me." You mumble in a soft whisper. You feel a push from behind but it quickly fades. The lighting changes and you shield your eyes for only a moment to adjust to the bright lights of the gymnasium. You pause for only a moment before shrugging it off. 'I must of blanked out for a minute there, I really don't remember walking out into the gym though.' You reassure yourself. You begin to walk towards the rest of the class for warm-up exercises.

"Heya Sharon." Trisha-- another cheerleader says to you as she takes position by your side. "Umm... hi." You stutter for a moment, instinctively replacing her name for you to "Betty." You and all the students quickly turn towards the door to the girl's locker room when a loud scream is heard. A few loud footsteps and a door soaring open is the only time you get to wonder what happened before Betty comes running out.

"B--Betty!?" You stammer. She fastens herself before you, snatching your hand in a rude gesture. "What the hell did yo--" She begins before examining the fellow observers. You are pulled away to the girl's locker room and into the girl's bathroom where Betty resumes her banter.

"What the hell-- the fuck did you do to me!? Why do I look like you!?" She screams at you. You shrug and take a small step back out of confusion. "W-what do you mean, Betty?" You reply.

"D-d-d-on't you dare call me that! I'm Sharon you dumb bitch and you know it." She declares, stuttering under the strain of her heightened confusion and anger.

"Sharon?" You respond, a bit bewildered by the unexpected twist. The angry expression on Betty's face is something you have seen only on a few occasions but never at you. "Yes you id-- give me my body back!" She demands.

Dim-witted, you were under the impression you were back to your own body since she came running out of the locker room but with curiosity in mind, you turn your head to the mirror which has been present in this bathroom from the beginning. You wave your hand, seeing Sharon's reflection mimic you flawlessly. "Woah..." You say in shock, moving closer to the mirror to inspect yourself further. You strain your fingers through Sharon's long hair, contorting your changed body to the desired positions to really accentuate Sharon's large breasts and butt. "Wow." You mindlessly say. Betty's visage only gets more frustrated and slaps you in the back.

"S--stop admiring my figure! Give me my body back!" She yells out.

A few realizations hit you. This time the words of wishing the same situation would dawn on Sharon is clear in your mind. Recalling further, you even remember wishing Betty could go talk to Robert for you. Curious but not sure you...

1242212211221221.content:
With thoughts in your head about how you may actually have the ability to swap bodies at will, you eagerly wear a smile, lighting up your new facial features. "Sorry, Sharon but you need to learn to stop being such a bitch to me for no reason. You're stuck as me for the rest of the day." You state, hopefully not under false claims of ability. Sharon clenches her fists in agitation and begins to shout in objection. "No way! Fuck that! I'm not being you-- never!"

You lean in close to her with a smile, placing both hands calmly on your projecting hips. "I can make this situation a lot worse you know. Go through the rest of the day pretending to be me or I'll make you regret it. Alright, Betty?" You threaten. Having coped with this situation previously, you have an edge over Sharon who is looking at you, distorted and saddened expressions interchanging upon her face.

"Fine... I'll go through the rest of the day as you but so help me if I am not myself when I wake up tomorrow-- I'll make your life a living hell." She portends, an ill dislike of her altered stature clear in her voice. She walks out of the bathroom, you shortly follow with a sigh of relief. You hate pretending to be mean but you realize already that it is a good choice to feign this as your doing-- again perhaps not you wonder. After class you plan to find out if you really did cause this to happen. Regardless if this is your doing or not, switching with Sharon would be nothing but complicated if she realized that you had no clear idea on how this happened. She would surely make a fool out of Betty-- something you would never wish to see.

Walking out into the gymnasium, you are greeted by a few curious stares from the other students and faculty from Sharon's previous outburst. You can only depict that she also came under similar stares as she exited the locker room. The teachers don't seem to interfere about what it was about which you find a relief. While you want to take your place away from any else to avoid any awkward conversations, Sharon's popularity precedes you as Trisha and a few other girls join around you. "What was that about?" Trisha questions.

"Nothing, forget about it." You reply. The ditsy, short girl doesn't seem appeased by the response and pushes it further. "Come on, I want to know." She nearly pouts out. Still a bit irked by Sharon, you decide to take a more pronounced stature. "Drop it, you little twerp." You tell her. Perhaps not mean by anyone else's standards you already begin to feel a snip bad but the small girl doesn't seem taken back by it but she does drop the subject. Up until your experience as Betty, Sharon has always been quite nice to you-- you begin to feel that maybe she is mean to most.

"Hey, what about that Victoria girl?" You blurt out with a twitchy smirk.

"What about her?" Trisha responds. Her legs fully outstretched as she bends downward in a remarkable display of flexibility as her chest hits the floor with ease. "Only thing I know about her is her best friend is that bitchy girl Betty and she is a pretty blond who you want to join the team." She furthers.

"Oh." is all you reply with. Ceasing your stretch you bring a finger to your lip and think for a moment. You do recall Sharon asking you a couple times about joining the cheerleaders. Is she nice to me because she wants me to join the team?' You ponder, a bit pleased that you learned something new-- if not a bit curious as to if her attitude towards you would alter once you joined the team.

The rest of gym goes fairly normal. The fan girls who follow you about are a bit surprised by "Sharon's" urge to actually participate in gym. You also go out of your way to lecture the real Sharon about acting more like Betty, I.E. participating. She is frustrated by the request but does her best, which is surprisingly well.

The bell rings as you exclude yourself from the gymnasium, an all too ominous glare from Sharon given to you as she watches you walk off with her body. Unsure at all about where Sharon's next class is, you disregard it and try to find Betty.

Passing by the hordes of students, projecting themselves as obstacles, you do eventually find Betty. You snag her arm and smile at her. A frown of disgust written on her face for a moment before fading to an obvious fake smile. "What is it, Sharon?" She asks.

"Come with me for a minute." You order, trying to drag her away but she is abstinent about budging. "Sorry, my class is right here." She replies. A bit annoyed that your identity isn't know to your very best friend, you drag her close and whisper into her ear. "It's me, Victoria!"

Her mouth is gaping and a endless eight of blinks define her eyes. You try to drag her off, now more cooperative, she follows along willingly. You go into the bathroom, feigning a desire to need to go until all the other girls inside leave.

You both exit your stalls. Betty gazes at you as if trying to tell if you're really Victoria. "Despite this face, voice and direct hairstyle, I am Victoria, Betty." You tell her. She takes a step towards you, eying you up and down; later playing with her wavy blond bangs. "How though? Why are you Sharon?" She questions.

You twiddle your fingers together and try to cover your smile. "Well I'm not sure but... I think I may be the cause of these swaps." You unveil to her.

"Really? How?" She asks out of curiosity.

"Well I'm not sure but I feel like if I wish for it to happen it does." You respond, blushing out of the stupidity of the verbalization. She curls her lip and places a hand on her hip. "Really now? So you wished for us to switch bodies in the first place-- why?" She asks.

"Well no... I wanted to swap with you because I wanted you to go in my place to chase Robert, I didn't know it would actually happen. I didn't remember that until I swapped with Sharon, she was irritating me and I wanted her to experience how great it is to be you so she would learn that you're not a bitch. Next thing I knew I was in her body. I feel like it's too good a coincidence to not be my fault." You explain to her. She thinks for a moment, garnering some sort of reply to this unprecedented conversation topic.

"So... have you tried to swap with anyone else yet?" She asks. Shaking your head in response you tell her that you want test it with her.

"Go for it." She says with a smile. You take a deep breath and wish that you were in your own body again. A similar feeling immersing itself as a push from behind is given but in only a instant you are now looking out of your own eyes again, looking at Sharon's body. Her face glows as she looks at you, more so as she gazes at her reflection in the mirror. "Oh my god-- I'm Sharon! It worke-- you can really swap bodies." She screams in hype to the situation.

You take position next to her. You grab all your hair and fluff it, the lovely feelings of your fine hair tingling the back of your neck. "It feels a bit weird being myself even after only a day of being out of it." You say. Betty alters her awed gander from her new reflection to you with a bright smile upon her well-defined face. "This is SO cool!" She restates her feelings from the previous swap.

"So can you do other things?" She asks. You think about it for a moment but don't recall doing anything but body swaps to people. "I don't think so.. umm.. I wish a million dollars would appear in this bathroom." You say in a jest, a small part of you thinking it may actually happen.

"Doesn't seem like it..." You conclude.

"So you can only swap bodies with people?" She asks. You fold your arms and think once more on it but again only body swapping has seemed to work.

"So it seems." You say.

"What a particular power!" Betty divulges. You smile and nod in agreement.

"Still, think of the possibilities! If you can really swap with anyone you could be anyone you wanted!" She notifies.

"No way! I can't go abusing this. Besides, I need to swap you back... I wonder if I can swap people other than myself." You tell her. She seems unimpressed by your priorities over good and evil but smiles over your unchanged ways.

"Well that's fine but leave me as Sharon for a little bit. I want to have a little fun as this bitchy cheerleader." She declares.
