"A--ah! H--how can we help-- be of service?" You struggle to say between your nervous stutters. You watch him diligently, enveloped with each of his nervous glances around the room as he mumbles random mismatched sentences. "How do I put this? There's this girl I like..." He claims which raise your eyes higher than they've ever been with a record in heartbeats to match. "And you want to swap with her?" Betty assumes but before he is allowed to answer such a question you press your hands against the table and ask a more personal question... "Who is it!?" The eagerness of the question seems to put him off but after a moments hesitation her does begin to answer... "I guess you'd probably need to know that anyways. Her name's Victoria and she's..."

While you cannot hear what descriptions her provides for you due to his dampening volume, you're left absolutely speechless as despite your inkling that Robert may like you, you never thought you would really hear it. You sink into your chair with a sigh of delight, Betty's chuckles of enthusiasm only sinking the truth in further. You can't believe it but Robert really did just say that he likes you, in person, right in front of you and if not for the cowl masking your face, he would be saying it to you knowingly. "Um... is something wrong?" He asks as he peers over the small desk which has now surpassed your view point from your sliding. "Oh, no, nothing." You bark with a chipper echo as you sit yourself back up straight.

A few seconds of mute stares leave you fumbling for what to do before Betty asks her question yet again... "So you want to swap with her?" He chuckles and bashfully tugs at his cheeks, you can't help but be intoxicated by his cuteness. "I-- I can't even imagine that but uh... the thing I sort of want to know if she likes me too. I think swapping with her directly would bad-- err... be bad, it may she just make her think I'm creepy or something." He explains but in truth, you'd love the proposal simply because you know he wants it-- though you must admit the idea of being a man is far too out there for you. "Anyways, yesterday I had the strangest experience where I was in Victoria's best friends body. It was so odd and I had no idea what was going on but it did give me an idea." He continues but as he reaches such a point, Betty chimes in yet again.

"To test this we were swapping students at a nearby school, it's possible you were involved." She informs him which leaves a pleasant smile along his lips. "Really? So that was real? It-- it sure felt real..." He tells you as a few of his fingers press against his chest for just long enough to give you a hint at what he means. You turn to Betty, finding her eye contact fading as she nervously scratches at the base of neck. "So..." Robert begins, not providing you time to relish in Betty's nervous disposition. "I was thinking that if I swapped with Betty I co-- Betty's the name of her best friend by the way. I could figure out if she likes me pretty easily. Is that... possible?" He finishes with the proposal which leaves Betty and you gesturing with each other with only your eyes. "One moment." You say as you huddle in the back with Betty. "What do we do?" You ask but what you really want to know is if Betty is alright with it. Sure you're a little put off that Robert really is too shy to just ask you directly with some confidence but at least you know he's willing to do quite a lot for you. "You want me to swap with him? Even if I do, if we do it right now it'll be a problem." She tells you.

"I know but we have to tell him something. Just tell me if you want to do it or not. If you don't we can just tell him the real rules-- in other words, that he needs your consent." You say towards Betty who's eyes whisk away as she makes a decision.
1242212211221221112212111111.title: Robert Bennet

choices: Swap perspective to Betty or Robert.
12422122112212211122121111111.content:
You can see the dark silhouette of Betty's lips moving unnervingly beneath her mask as she ponders the idea, eventually letting out a long sigh and an agreement... "Fine, I'll swap with him but just so you know, I'm sure going through a lot for your little love affair." You smile back at her a feverish excitement present upon your covered face but while you begin to stretch your arms to hug her, you retract yourself as your company speaks up from behind you. "Um... hello?" Robert says as he taps the desk a few times. "Thank you." You say simply to Betty before returning to your seat to sit comfortable just inches from the boy you pine for. "So?" He expels once more, imploring you to return to the previous discussion.

"We've decided that we'd love to help." You tell him simply which brings quite the smile to his face but only in equal contest to his embarrassment as the idea of being a girl seeps into his mind and clouding his vision with thoughts. "Ah.. but I don't really have any money." He suddenly says sounding thoroughly displeased as his hand thrashes his knee in anger. You meet his poorness with cruel eyes, crushing it dastardly with a soft smile and a non-existent 'special... "Love is involved so let's just call this a free special we're having." You tell him as you lean across the desk between you, your long sleeves gliding around the papers along it. "Really? Thank you!" He exclaims as he pounds his fist into his hand several times; the excitement illuminating his energy while Betty remains starved of such a thing as you hear her cries from behind.

"So... how does this work?" He asks as his fists settle to a stop and his eyes docile to a captivating innocence. You didn't really think much about how to swap him with Betty but thankfully Betty herself seems to have as she steps closer. "Normally we need the consent of both but since we're nice, we're not making you follow that rule so tonight while you're asleep you'll be swapped with this Betty girl. Do us all a favor and try to get everything done in one day, alright?" She explains. He nods several times as he lifts from his chair to shake both of your hands. "I will, thank you both for this." He says as he backs out of the shack almost in a run.

The cowl slides off both of your faces as you both fall to a sit with long sighs to release the pressure. "You owe me." Betty says bluntly as she unmasks her face to show the stern expression beneath. You unmask yourself as well as you ponder what to even say towards her generous willingness. Her cold expression seems to fail and her knees become anxious as they bob up and down in her Indian style as you plainly stare at her without a word. She eventually just lets out a loud groan and rolls onto her back. "Ah! He better not do anything to me-- though I guess after what we did with his body... I can't really be critical." She realizes as you both swell up in the face as the feelings from yesterday come swirling back. You certainly can't deny how much you loved the feeling, it's almost pathetic that your first time was with Betty even if it was Robert's body.

"I guess being a man was kinda cool so I guess I don't mind that much but... you still owe me." She states once more as she climbs to her feet and begins to remove of her robes, as you do. "Thanks again for this." You tell her as you both prepare to leave but her sweat glistening face does little to realize a happy disposition. "I don't know why you don't just ask him out. You're both wimps at this." She says rather cruelly as she walks by you. You merely laugh awkwardly as you follow in her wake as usual.

--

You stay up a few hours later than usual to make sure both Betty and Robert are fast asleep and cast a thought in your mind that they would both swap places just before your own head hits your pillow...
12422122112212211122121111111.title: "Fine, I'll swap with him."

124221221122122111221211111111.content: Do you want to follow Robert's point of view as he wakes up in Betty's body or Betty's point of view as she goes through the day as a man?
124221221122122111221211111111.title: Swap perspective to Betty or Robert.

choices: You fail to respond correctly and blow your cover.
You come up with a work around to her claim.
1242212211221221112212111112.content:
You are both a bit surprised as the well figured girl Sharon Winterly rattles her way through the cabin door, proclaiming Betty's presence.

"Hello Betty!" She shouts with a confident smirk on her face. You and Betty both look at each other for a moment, a bit shocked that she knows Betty is here.

"W--what makes you think one us is named Betty?" You ask. Sharon takes her place in one of the chairs in front of your table, folding her legs and tossing her hair; the same confident smirk on her face. "I thought I dreamed it but after I saw this paper I knew it was real. Betty switched bodies with me, I know one of you is her since she switched bodies with me!" She explains. You stutter, a bit lost on how to respond to her claim as it is partly true.
1242212211221221112212111112.title: Sharon Winterly

choices: Tell Sharon you can't go through with it.
12422122112212211122121111122.content:
You place a hand gently on the table, lifting the other as you formulate your response. "It's true that I swapped quite a few members of your school yesterday. This Betty girl is the... brown haired girl if I recall, correct?" You ask. She plays along with the same smirk upon her face and answers your question. "Yes, that's her."

You outlay your hands as you further your explanation. "Well, if I recall, you also claimed to have the power to swap bodies when I swapped you with some blond girl. The Betty girl merely acted the same way as you." Sharon's eyes widen a bit and she stiffens her shoulders as your work around sinks in. "S--still, that's not..." She stumbles over her own retort.

"I assure you neither of us are this Betty girl nor are we young enough to even be in high school. We just happened to think a school would be a good place to test this new ability." Betty says from behind you, feigning a quite expressive Irish accent. Sharon remains quiet as she thinks about the evidence formed against her before eventually shrugging it off. "Fine. However, I would like something you did to me yesterday done again." She states. You blink a few times as you think about what it could be but later ask "What?"

"I want you to swap me back with Victoria Wilson." She says in quite a serious statement. "I.. uh.. well, I'm afraid you need two willing participants." You reply, stammering over the shock that Sharon wants to be you again. You can't help but wonder why. Sharon wears a foul expression of disappointment as she clicks her tongue in frustration, arms folded under her large breasts. "Well, how much would it take for you to do it without her consent?" She questions.

"A lot." You reply on reflex. "How much to do it permanently? Name a price." She asks.

"P--permanently?" You and Betty both blurt out. "Why do you want to be this girl so much?" You ask out of vicious curiosity. Sharon's serious expression fades to a much more docile, timid expression as she gazes down at herself. "I--I don't know. I've just always been jealous of her. I'm rich, I'm pretty and popular, yet I find myself jealous of her no matter what. When I saw her reflection as my own I knew it was how I wanted to look-- exactly." She admits to you which only blows your mind in quite a vast way.

"Looks aren't everything." You hear Betty say from behind you. "I'm aware of that... but it's not just looks. You can't tell me you haven't just felt something and thought it was right. Some people find true love from just a feeling they get. I found a body that feels like it was made for me, flaws and all, I want to look like her. Does this sound bizarre? My parents sent me to a psychologist about it once. He said that I just projecting all my desires into Victoria, basically forcing her image to what I really wanted when it really isn't-- but I think I really do want to be her." She elaborates. The sincere, cooperative girl in front of you is not like you experienced when you were Betty but as yourself you have always noticed Sharon being overly nice to you. This explains her singled expressions towards you and you alone.

"O--one moment." You say as you stand out of your chair to speak with Betty. "She's nuts." Betty says as soon as your ear is close enough for her whisper. "I found it really weird when she was so mean to me when I was you compared to how nice she was to me when I was myself. I guess this explains it. So... what do we do?" You say.

"Just say some outrageous price so she leaves or just just say no-- obviously." Betty suggests.
12422122112212211122121111122.title: You come up with a work around to her claim.

choices: Go along with it, just to see how it turns out.
124221221122122111221211111222.content:
You seat yourself once more, garnering austere stares from Sharon. "Umm, 5 million dollars." You tell her, gesturing your fingers in conjunction with your words. Sharon looks away, mouthing indiscernible things with her lips, a hand clasping her chin. "I guess I should have figured as much. Anyways, deal." She responds after quite a session of self-debate.

"D-d-deal!?" You cower out, a knot forming in your stomach.

"Yes, I'll give you 5 million dollars if you swap me permanently with Victoria Wilson." She restates with quite a calm and happy smile. "U--uh...." You mouth, getting up to speak with Betty once more. "What does she mean she'll give us 5 million?" You whisper in a loud shout.

"Well, I knew Sharon was rich but... maybe she is like a billionaire. Makes me wonder what she is doing living here though." She whispers back.

"How many rich people are on the cheer leading team?" You ask in fright of the situation.

"Well, Trisha is just well off, like 120,000$ a year I think. Seems Sharon is a billionaire-- though how her parents would let her spend 5 million dollars is beyond me." She says. You pinch your side in dislike of the situation and shake your head. "No way. No way her parents would let her do that, especially for something like this." You convince yourself.

"Well, for 5 million dollars, I might give up my body." Betty jests with a sassy grin beneath her mask. "You want me to do it!?" You scream in as soft a voice as you can. "You might as well go along with it, not like she has the money." Betty says.
124221221122122111221211111222.title: Joke out some absurd price.

choices: Continue with the shop or something else.
Betty wants to check out Sharon's home now that she is best friends with "her."
1242212211221221112212111112221.content:
"Umm, sure." You say to Sharon in a backwards meaning. "Great!" She exclaims as she jumps from her chair, hands clasped together. "I'll go to the bank then, though I doubt they will have 5 million. Hmm, I'll be back in a little bit with the money." She assures you as she hustles out of the cabin.

"Is this for real...?" You question.

"If it is, you just sold your life for 5 million dollars." Betty reminds you with a twisted delight of your bad decision making. You shake your head ravenously, knocking around all the negative thoughts. "No way she'll bring 5 million dollars! She is 18, rich family or not there is no way she can get 5 million just like that." You explain with a snap of your fingers to emphasize the haste.

"Shouldn't you be going?" Betty tells you.

"What do you mean?" You ask, turning your head towards her in confusion.

"Well, when you swap with Sharon, it may be awkward if she finds out you were the crazy body swap lady. Best go on home, I'll call if you she comes back with the money." She says with an all too devilish grin, a hand on her hip as is her custom.

You jab your hand out in protest. "I am NOT switching with her even if she brings the money." You yell.

"I guess it's noble of you not selling yourself for money but... 5 million dollars, you'd become part of a rich family, popular and quite damn attractive taboot-- despite Sharon being a bitch but that part doesn't apply to you at least." She defines all the positive aspects about the swap to you.

"Tha--that's stupid. I won't sell myself for money... I feel a bit bad for her though, she really wants to be me for some strange reason." You say.

"Being you is nice but I wasn't that into it, she is totally obsessed with you. I'd swap with her if not to just see if she really likes it so much." She replies. You take her response more seriously than you should and tell Betty that "I'll go through with it then. Maybe she won't even like being me. I am curious to see if she will enjoy my life as much as she thinks she will." Betty is quite surprised by your sudden willingness but agrees somewhat with your decision.

You find yourself a few blocks from your house, wearing a normal set of clothing in place of your recent robe. Your cellphone rings and upon answering it you hear...

"I'm just calling my partner, she had to go find the Victoria girl-- Hello?" Betty says still using her fake Irish charade in-front of Sharon.

"Hey, did she seriously bring 5 million dollars?" You question, seriously hoping for a negative response as your stomach fills with knots of uncertainty.

"Yes, she brought the money." She answers. You sigh in defeat as you think about how this will all go over. "Are you ready to swap, Sharon?" You hear over the line along with a "Yes!" in quite a loud burst. You place the phone in your purse and with quivering lips say "I wish... Sharon and I swapped bodies." The natural feelings that usually accompany your wishes for swaps continue to remain constant as you say the words, despite being negligent towards the switch.

You instinctively touch your forehead in response to the swap. In place of your normally parted hair you feel fine hair placed in a line across your brow, extending in length as it reaches the edge of your eye, continually lengthening until it reaches your elbows in length. You look down to find yourself wearing a white scoopneck shirt, plumping quite nicely from the large chest features you now possessed. Lowering to your legs you notice small denim shorts covering a slim section of your thighs, the rest of your legs quite ample. Cool tan colored skin making up your coverage, a trait you are quite amazed you didn't notice the last time you were in Sharon's body. You bring a hand up to scratch your head only to notice of the very beautiful fake nails on your fingers; though you think they look nice, you have never once wanted to use them as they are quite a nuisance to have on.

"Did it work?" Betty asks.

"Sadly. It's me, Victoria." You say as you scratch your scalp with your bright nails. Betty shakes her head and places a open suitcase on the table, opening it up to reveal a vast amount of cash which you can't help but lean over. "Woah!" you exclaim.

"I am pretty sure with this 5 million dollars, the transaction is complete which would make you... Sharon Winterly." She explains to you with a bit of a sly grin as she lowers the mask on her face.

"W--what!? No way!" You protest.

"Way, you just sold your body/life for 5 million dollars. I'm going to call you Sharon now in spirits of our transaction and our newly acquired profit." She tells you which you can't help but nearly cry over. "But I don't... want to be Sharon." you pout. Betty slaps your loose hand on the table which you quickly retract in reflex. "Sorry, Sharon but I'm overall quite surprised you went through with it. So since you actually did, I think it's just that I call you Sharon from now on since you have her body, voice and what not. Hey, at least you're not bitchy like the real Sharon, you're still my best friend-- you just look different." She explains to you.

"Well... hopefully Sharon gets sick of being me quickly so I can return to normal..." You say in hope of returning to a normal life.
1242212211221221112212111112221.title: Go along with it, just to see how it turns out.

choices: He tells you that "your" parents are quite angry with you.
12422122112212211122121111122212.content:
You gaze into the round mirror you plucked from Sharon's purse, eying your face and it's much different defining outlines. You let out a pathetic whine to gather sympathy from Betty who is hanging over your shoulder. "Oh shush, you're the one who went through with it." She says. You lower your head and dispatch of the mirror. "I just want to see if she really will like my life as much as she thinks she will. Then I'll switch back." You reply. She straightens herself, hands placed a tad above her behind. "Which makes you Sharon right now." She affirm. A twitch from the sad fact being your only response.

"Speaking of which..." She begins, a sly grin forming on her perky lips. "Since you're my best friend now Sharon, can I see your house?" She asks of you. You raise from your awkward position on the floor, prompting a swift glare at Betty for speaking to you as if you have always been Sharon. "Stop that..." You demand from her, she does no such thing.

"Well can I? 5 million is enough for today I think." She asks once more.

"Fine, whatever." You answer.

Betty begins to take off her robes, you take the time to think about nothing in particular; a surprising delight. You do however stumble over your lack of knowledge about Sharon's situation. "Hey, where does Sharon live?" You ask. Betty stops in her tracks, bringing a finger to her chin in thought-- later folding her arms. "I uhh... can't seem to remember. If she is so rich, I find it hard to believe she lives near the school, not sure why she goes to this school if she lives far away either." She answers, supplying no new information to the endeavor.

"That makes going home a bit difficult." You jolt.

"Call one of your butlers or something to come pick you up." She suggests in a demeaning expression of her voice. You glance away with a distorted smile. "I uh... don't think all rich people have maids and stuff." You disclose to her.

"Well, check your purse." She says, situating herself next to you. You dig through the purse finding: make up, the mirror, papers and all sorts of random assortments, a wade of money and a school ID. "Nothing in here about her address." You announce as you take out Sharon's cellphone to surf through her contacts. You do find one labeled "home" and press it. The phone rings for a few short rings before being picked up by a raspy sounding individual.

"Winterly residence." He says.

"Um, it's me, S--Sharon." You divulge to him despite never wanting to say that you were in-fact her at the moment.

"Oh, miss...
12422122112212211122121111122212.title: Betty wants to check out Sharon's home now ...

124221221122122111221211111222122.content:
"Umm... yes, I was wondering if I could get a ride home." You ask the raspy man.

"What happened to Edward? Shouldn't he still be there?" He responds and without much evidence against the man's existence you say "Oh, right. Sorry." and hang up. Betty and you walk outside of the woods to find a limousine parked just a few feet from the dirt road. Your unmanageable discomfort is brought into sound as you whine between shut lips. Betty however is quite ecstatic as she clenches both her arms in excitement. "Wow, I've never been in a limo before. You're the best friend ever, Sharon." She exclaims with an underlying layer of insult to your position.

You shake the somber feeling of even your best friend calling you Sharon and step over to the limo with small wavering steps. Betty soon grows weary of your lack of enthusiasm and pushes you forward. You trip over your heels several times before stumbling into the window of the limo, an oriental man looking back at you. You say "Sorry" but he seems to pay it no mind as he climbs out the limo only to open the door for you.

"Where will we be heading, miss?" He asks. Sitting in the backseat with the galvanizing Betty, you struggle to even come up with an answer to such a simple question. "Um... I'd like to go home." You respond after a long moment of thinking or to be more precise, watching Betty take hold of everything in the limo. You can't say you're not also impressed by the sheer size of it but your focus is unfortunately on your own body even after the car motions itself towards a home you've never been to.

You slowly grind your long nails against your scalp and through the long pale brown hair which Sharon just so recently gave to you. It's nice and all but you find your own much more desirable. "I know she is pretty and all but I don't think I could ever get used to this." You pout as you look into the many things reflecting your current image.

Betty takes her hand out of one of the many small drawers and leans back against you. "Calm down, would you? You have the power to change it all back. There is no point in worrying so much, Sharon." She reasons for you which would have been a nice gesture had she not teased you with your current name.

Looking out the window after a ten minute drive you wonder what neighborhood you're in until you hear and feel the car stop that is. You look a bit confused but as you gaze out the front windshield you find a huge house at the end of this apparent yard which you mistook for a neighborhood. Betty's gasps of astonishment are contagious as you exit the car spewing similar amazement. "T--thanks for the ride." You say to the driver who takes the comment in with little satisfaction.

"It's no wonder I never knew where she lived. Did her parents build this place or something? There are no other houses like this anywhere here." Betty wonders out loud as you both trek across the gap between the car and house.

With no one at the door you open it to a home drenched with vibes of the rich. You can't accurately describe it but the building actually makes you blush from it's beauty. Despite it's abundance of accessories, you don't find anyone in the large home even after trekking upstairs at Betty's request.

"This is so cool." Betty chimes as she glides a hand across the grandfather clock in the hallway which begins to chime along with her.

"This feels... wrong." You whisper as you make your way through the halls as if looking for something, perhaps Sharon's room. However...
124221221122122111221211111222122.title: He asks what you need.

choices: You decide to check how Victoria (as you) is doing
You're interrupted by your cellphone ringing.
1242212211221221112212111112221222.content:
You finally stumble into a room with the name "Sharon" written in huge gold letters in the front. Yep, that must definitely be the room you were looking for.

After hesitating a bit in front of the door, maybe because you're extremely nervous about this "new life"of yours, Betty punches you gently in the arm, bringing you back to reality.

"Hey, don't chicken out now ! After all, you chose this life, Sharon !" You find it extremely irritating to be called by her name yet again, but begin to wonder if Betty's not trying to
help you settle in, in a way. After all, if you choose to respect the deal you made earlier, this will be your life – permanently. So you might just as well get used to it.

As you ponder all of this, Betty decides to take matters into her own hands by opening the door, just to open her mouth in awe immediately afterwards. When you enter the room,
you quickly understand why : this room may be larger than the house you previously lived in ! (as Victoria)It's also extremely richly decorated, with Betty quickly targeting what
seems to be a huge dressing with all sorts of stuff – you feel like you are reading a fashion magazine, only to realize it's all yours. After all, even if you REALLY miss your body
and life, this may not be such a bad deal....

Just then...
1242212211221221112212111112221222.title: You find her room.

choices: It wasn't your phone - Sharon (as you) is calling Betty
12422122112212211122121111122212222.title: You're interrupted by your cellphone ringing.

choices: You're interrupted by the butler - someone wants to see you
124221221122122111221211111222122221.content:
At first you thought it was your phone, but it appears it was Betty's, as she quickly looked in her purse and seemed surprised :

« Sharon, it's you...i mean, Victoria's calling me ! »

You exchanged quizzical looks, but asked her :

« Maybe she's getting in character, so to speak? »

It was the only logical explanation you could find : if Sharon wanted to have the full « Victoria Watson experience », then she must
have wanted to contact her new « best friend » immediately, and start over without looking back, even if it meant being friends with
someone she seemed to hate when she had her original body. But after all, if you learnt something today, it's that you definitely
didn't know what this girl was up to...or was she really was thinking, and that applied to her feelings for Betty too.

Just then...
124221221122122111221211111222122221.title: It wasn't your phone - Sharon (as you) is c...

choices: Betty says she wants to swap with you.
Betty says you'll get used to it and to just give it time.
124221221122122111221211111222122222.content:
While the ringing of Sharon's phone doesn't bring any instincts about your own phone ringing, as the sound continues to exhume from your purse you eventually answer it. "Hello?" You say with little excitement to form any conversations with your new persona.

"Hey Sharon, it's Victoria..." She introduces herself as if all was as normal and continues in her words without much hesitation. "... I just wanted to tell you that I am interested in joining the Cheerleaders. I know you have been trying to get me to join for a long time and I think I'm fine with it now. So suddenly, it's so strange huh?" While her flow of words sound normal in every way you can sense the hints below her breath that she is quite ecstatic all of this.

"Who is it?" Betty asks from the continuous frightful expression you wear. You don't answer her and instead decide to reply to Sharon who is so patiently awaiting your response. You wish to tell her everything just so you can swap her back but instead feign normality. "That's great to hear, Victoria." Is your reply which also answers Betty's question.

The voice sounds a bit irked by your response however and says "Umm...g--good, I'll see you tomorrow then." Perhaps she was not expecting a calm reply and in hindsight perhaps you should have played things off as more of a surprise. After all, Sharon believes she swapped herself with you; a person unaware of this strange magic.

"Alright, see you tomorrow." You close with as you return the phone to your purse. Betty curls her lip and places a hand on her hip. Somehow she manages to form so many expressions with the same position as you can see her curiosity vividly.

"She wants to join the cheer leading team. She's acting like everything is just fine." You inform Betty who just lets off a soft hum of thought. You sigh and sit yourself on the edge of the lavish bed which has it's own sheeted ceiling. "I guess she is already trying to change my life to more suit her. Maybe I should undo this sooner rather than later so my life doesn't get changed..." You brood.

Betty however has a different perspective as she sits down next to you with an outstretched arm. "Are you serious!? Look at this place!" She cries out, carrying your vision with her hand. You sigh once more and take yourself over to the full length mirror and gently stroke a length of your hair. "I know but... look at me." You reply softly as you take in all the feelings that accompany seeing your reflection in such a way. The long light brown hair, the well figured body, supple tan easily visible from the skimpy clothing would make most happy but you instead dread the sight. Betty furthers the oddly dreaded admiration by complimenting Sharon's image. "I would never say it to the real one but Sharon is very hot. I think you're better looking but I'm just saying, it's not like your losing out on much in terms of beauty."

You turn to her flustered and irritable, shouting "That's not the point! The point is this isn't me." You then say something that perhaps you shouldn't have said as when you turn back to your reflection you say... "I was more comfortable as you than I am as Sharon."
124221221122122111221211111222122222.title: Sharon (as you) is calling

choices: Why not? You're better at being Betty than Sharon at the very least.
Living as Sharon for a little longer is probably better.
1242212211221221112212111112221222221.content:
You continue to stare into the reflection, the beautiful features of the body somehow distorting to a hideous reminder of your situation. You spot Betty's reflection surfacing from behind you until she is standing by your side, looking at your reflection as well. You watch her as her eyes bat between your face and her own, your legs and hers and other places as well. She looks a bit drought in her expression, a rare somber highlight in her eye. It lasts only until she runs a hand through your hair and while you look at her confused, her trademark motions return to her. She discards of her ilk and places a hand onto her hip but not before it passes by her cheek to toss her hair.

"Well, if you're more comfortable being me then swap with me. I don't mind being Sharon, I think it'd be cool." She suggests with a large smile pushing at her cheeks. You aren't particularly surprised by her suggestion from her previous enthusiasm at wanting to be Sharon but at the same time, are hesitant to go through with the request. It's true you feel more natural as Betty but part of you wants to be Sharon for a little longer for reasons you don't even know yet.
1242212211221221112212111112221222221.title: Betty says she wants to swap with you.

choices: You sleep to the next day - time to go back to school as Sharon
12422122112212211122121111122212222212.content:
After giving it some thought, you decide against swapping with Betty right now.
You made the final decision when you swapped with Sharon, so you might as well
give it some time before thinking about swapping back...it hasn't even been a day yet !

You tell Betty that you intend to stay in Sharon's body a little longer, and while she seems
understanding, you can clearly see she would have prefered to test Sharon's hot bod.
You haven't yet seen Sharon in your body, you don't know anything about her life, so you
decide to give it at least a couple of days before swapping back.

After a quick inspection of Sharon's bedroom, Betty realizes it's getting pretty late, and
hurries back home after hugging you goodbye.

You stand alone in this vast bedroom, wondering what to do...and whether or not
Sharon appreciates her dream body.
12422122112212211122121111122212222212.title: Living as Sharon for a little longer is probabl...

choices: Try to find some clues about Sharon
Go back to your house and talk to her
1242212211221221112212111112221222222.content:
« Calm down. » Betty, still a hand on her hip as usual, is carrying a oddly focused look.

« I think there's a simple reason why you were more comfortable as me than you are as Sharon : you just know me almost as well as you know yourself...
well, when you were Victoria, but you get the point. »

Even if you hate to admit it, you know that your situation as best friends helped the transition a lot during your first body swap.

« I think there's a few things you could do to ease your transition as Sharon : you could try to find some clues here for example...i'm pretty sure she must
have a diary of some sort ! »

« Yeah, i guess i could look for it, give it a couple of days...after all, i still have the option to swap back if it really becomes unbearable. »

Betty strokes her hair, then points her finger at you in an enthusiastic way :

« There's another way ! »

« And what is it? »

« You could ask Sharon. »

You drop your jaw, not seeing where Betty is going and you begin to wonder if she has lost it, when she adds :

« I mean, we put on a good acting show when we swapped the two of you. You could go back to your house as Sharon, and play the part. Tell her you tried
to act cool on the phone, and then break down in tears, or do whatever you need to do to make her believe you. »

You put a finger in front of your mouth, wondering if this could work. But hey, if you fooled her last time, why couldn't it work now? Besides, even if Sharon
wants to give your life a makeover, she could use some tips on your habits, your family and friends, among other things. This would be another trade of sorts.

« Yeah, i guess i could trade some information with her by pretending i was a victim of the swap...that could definitely work. »

Betty lets you think about it for a while, then finally asks :

« What will you do? »
1242212211221221112212111112221222222.title: Betty says you'll get used to it and to jus...

choices: Screw hiding your powers, go confront Sharon about this whole thing.
Time will tell, you might as well play this out.
12422122112212211122121111122212222221.content:
Looking around the large room for things that could hold any importance to Sharon's life, you stop in your tracks as your hand gently slides across the finely shined dresser. "Why look for clues anyways? This isn't like when I swapped with you and wanted to keep our swap a secret by acting like you. To Sharon, she wants my life so should I really even bother trying to do what she does?" You muse to Betty, whom while understanding still boasts some meaning to your search.

"You can drop out of cheer leading and dump all her stupid friends but it couldn't hurt to at least know a little background about her life." She reasons as she looks into the drawers of Sharon's nightstand. Still uninterested in knowing anything at the moment, you lay yourself onto the bed, cupping your head in your defiance of gravity as you let out a sigh. Despite her motioning head you can make out Betty's long smile from her bulging cheeks. "What is it?" You ask. She turns around with a book in her hand which you assume is a diary of sorts but Betty soon corrects you.

"It's not a diary per say, it's something much cooler." She begins as she seats herself next to you, utilizing such a small portion of the giant space provided. You lift yourself upward and look over her shoulder, a bit amazed while mutually disgusted by the sight. The book Betty found doesn't really tell you much about Sharon at least in the way you would like to know-- it does however, tell a lot about you.

"D--don't tell me she has been stalking me." You exhume from your perplexed emotions. Betty scratches her head and tosses her hair briefly before shrugging with a twisted grin. "She's quite crazy. I'm only skimming but this whole book seems to about you. What you like to eat, wear, do for fun and other such things-- hell, it even has some details on your family. She is far more obsessed with you than I thought." Rattles Betty as she continues to flip through the book. The feeling of discomfort and the actions it takes on your body certainly seem to be common as your new stomach begins to tie itself around and around. "I-- this is... not right." You mumble as you snatch the book from Betty's hands.

"Why would she be this-- I don't understand. She's pretty and popular and from my perspective before all this happened, nice as well. This isn't right..."
12422122112212211122121111122212222221.title: Try to find some clues about Sharon

124221221122122111221211111222122222211.content:
Sharon was willing to pay your absurd price just to have the chance to be in
your shoes. Maybe this should have raised some concerns. However, for
some strange reason, you decided to give the girl a chance by indulging her
biggest wish : swapping permanently with you. Well, technically, just
swapping with you, the "permanent" part being completely up to you, since
you had the power.

Saying that you completely rejected everything about Sharon would be false.
After all, the girl was nice to you when you were still Victoria, and the fact that
you now had her seemingly endless amounts of money was also a nice touch.

The creepy part was the stalking/obsession thing. Finding her "stalker diary"
was just the last nail in the coffin : being Sharon Winterly was okay, but the
girl was waaaaaay too obsessed to be let in your body. You then decided to
go and confront her about the swap, tell her you possessed the power, and
most probably swap back to your original body.

You left your house with what appeared to be Sharon's car - a pink bmw m6
convertible, who looked like it was seldom used - and drove Betty back to her
house, promising her to call her later. You could tell she was a little disappointed
to see you wanting to swap back so fast, but she seemed to understand your motives.

You then drove back to your old house, finding it incredibly dull in comparison to
Sharon's. On the way, you had to readjust the rear mirror and you found yourself once
again drawn to Sharon's -now your- reflection. Hell, even if some things looked too fake
to be any good -the extra effort on the tan, the fake nails that were extremely hard to
adjust to- the girl was probably THE most beautiful girl in school...The only thing she was
lacking and that maybe you had was this "girl next door look" that you sometimes hated in
you. Everything in Sharon screamed sophistication, which was good but also made the girl
almost unreachable...You thought you'd love to have that "girl next door" look back, and
you were on your way to it.

With a flurry of thoughts still buzzing in your mind, you realized you had arrived at your house.
You parked the car, and went on to ring the doorbell. The door opened to reveal...
124221221122122111221211111222122222211.title: Screw hiding your powers, go confront Sharon ab...

1242212211221221112212111112221222222111.content:
...your mom.

"Hello, how may i help you young lady?"

"But, mo..." You froze in place. You had not guessed the obvious : while inhabiting Sharon's
body, you hadn't thought about one of the logical consequences : even your own mother
doesn't know who you are anymore. You had to adapt to this situation, and you quickly
snapped out of your reverie by answering :

"Hi Miss Wilson, i'm here to see Victoria."

"Okay...Excuse me for being so blunt but are you one of her school friends? I don't
remember seeing you around before..."

"I'm...Sharon Winterly. I'm in the same school as...Victoria."

"Is anything wrong dear? You look awfully pale."

The whole situation made you sick to your stomach, and you guess it must have showed
a lot...

"Just a little tired, don't worry about it Miss Wilson."

"Victoria, come here ! A friend's waiting to see you at the door !"

"Coming mom !"

Halfway through the stairs, and as soon as she saw you, "Victoria" froze into place.

"It's alright mom. We'll speak in the patio if it's ok."

"All right sweetie."

The new Victoria led you to your patio, and the sweet face she wore while in front of
your mother quickly faded to...
1242212211221221112212111112221222222111.title: ...your mother.

1242212211221221112212111112221222222111.content:
Her long grin persisted through her entire seating process; wrapping her long sky blue skirt around the knee of her folded legs and a slow hand brushing her bangs, folding around her ear before gliding down the side of her body as if to bring focus to the fact she now had your body. "I know why you're here and before you ask any needless questions... this is permanent. I'm Victoria now, you should get used to that fact." She declares with a cocky raising of her chin. You are easily flustered by her confidence and want to right then and there switch back with her but restrain yourself for now. Betty made you see how beautiful you can be and now Sharon is showing you just how sinister of an expression you can make.

You decide to start with a simple question... "Why did you do this?" It falls onto devilish disregard however, as Sharon merely tilts her head away. "I'm not telling you that." She replies, seemingly embarrassed about admitting her obsession to the obsessey point-blank. Realizing that the only way to get a serious response out of her will require some drastic measure you...
1242212211221221112212111112221222222111.title: ...a huge, sinister grin.

1242212211221221112212111112221222222111.content:
Desiring full control of the situation and for Sharon to admit to you her real reasons, you think deeply about returning to your normal body and before you can comprehend it, you're now sitting across the small table with legs crossed. Sharon looks at you for several seconds before realizing she is no longer Victoria and after a brief self-discovery, raises herself from the chair in protest. "G--give me my body back!" She screams it far too loudly so you calmly ask her to be quiet about it. You lean forward, placing an arm for support on the table. "I'm the one who has the ability to switch bodies. Now stop ignoring it and tell me the real reason you want to be me." You demand, gazing deeply into her shifting eyes that quiver from her predicament. "How can you do that?" She asks but you shoot down her attempt to change the subject with a quick and sadly true answer. "Don't know. Now tell me why you want to be me. I saw that creepy book of yours, it's just pages and pages about me." The mention of the book brings an ill expression onto the front of Sharon's face. Her lips open and close as if to start speaking but they do nothing but shiver.

It's far from your expectations but a tear finds it's way down Sharon's face, dripping only out of one eye while the other shimmers under the warm sun's light. She wipes it away the moment she feels it's cool touch, turning away from you in embarrassment. "L--look... I don't have a real reason. I just want to be you. I like everything about you and for the longest time I thought I was in love with you but I didn't find any other girl attractive in the slightest-- hell, I thought I would sooner find myself attractive before some random girl." She begins her somber ramble, weakness and disorientation making up her fortitude. You are quite sure that this expression is something you had made a frequent visit to while you had Sharon's face.

She reviews her body with a revolted character, coming to the conclusion that this really isn't how she wants to be. She wears a meek smile and while continuing to gaze at herself continues her words... "By most people's definition I am far prettier than you and even I sort of agree but I feel so much better as you. Everything... your face, your hair, your voice, your body... your life. It all feels right to me." You begin to feel uneasy, unconsciously bringing visual memory to each listing she makes, recalling yourself to see if you feel the same way she does about your body and life. She then shakes her head vigorously, her pale hair flourishing behind her and lashing at her face and as the motions end she clasps her hands together and leans toward you. "Please! I'm begging you... let me be you. I guarantee you I appreciate everything about your body and life more than you do! It felt perfect-- exactly how I want to be. My psychiatrist was wrong, I really do want to be you. So please..." She pleads with sincerity so endowed with clarity that she is assured that this is indeed exactly what she wants and you can regretfully sense that and amazingly, you feel guilty about keeping your own body. "You want me to give up my life?" You ask weakly, questioning whether or not you care about your life more than Sharon does.

She sighs but nods to your blunt question. She then takes up your hand, grasping it with both of hers. "I'm prettier than you, rich, popular, and yet I'm unhappy with this life. It's a great life but I want to be you-- with all your flaws, they're all perfect. Please..." Her pleads don't fall onto deaf ears-- though you wish they were as you cannot believe you are hesitant that staying as yourself is 'fair.' In the end you...
1242212211221221112212111112221222222111.title: Swap bodies with her to put her in her place.

1242212211221221112212111112221222222111.content:
You can't believe it until you are once again looking down at yourself and Sharon's large breasts hidden beneath her white scoopneck shirt but you switched back with her willingly. You can feel the clenching of your throat and stomach as well as the pressure in your eyes; all clear evidence that Sharon really was sincere. You look up at her only to watch her explode from confusion to happy little girl who got what she wanted. After jumping from joy in the most literally of ways, she leans and spams "Thank you, thank you, thank you!" She only ceases her repetition to assure a small fear she has... "Wait, are you going to keep us this way for good?" You have no answer to that question and merely lift one hand to shrug to her a "I don't know."

She takes it as a yes apparently, as she smiles eagerly before suddenly batting you on the chest. "Oh! Stay here, I'll be right back." She says and scurries off into the house. Perhaps she cannot sense how uncertain you are about all of this-- though you feel it's pretty clear as you're trying your best to convey it on your new face.

She comes scurrying back with a pen and paper and promptly starts writing things down. "I thought you could use some information about yourself, S--Sharon." She says, looking up at you nervously (probably frightened about losing your body) after calling you by her own name. "I definitely could use some." You admit with a nod and let her go at it.

"Let's see... you're a 34D... my locker combination is... you're 5'11... you have my taste buds now so believe me you'll enjoying eating these... class schedule... date of birth..." She mumbles aloud with each thing she writes but you really have no interest in it even if you are impressed by the 34D and 5'11. You don't really want to admit that you are actually giving up your life but while Sharon lists off the aspects of her body and life, all you can focus on is her shining smile; so pure in it's creation, in-fact you don't think you have ever seen such a happy expression. It disgusts you to realize it but you know that Sharon probably really does like being you more than you do. You sure never felt perfect when you were in your own body but at least you didn't feel awkward like you do now.

"Here ya go!" She exclaims suddenly, bursting you out of your trance and into a state of revision as you glance over the quite expansive list of details. "Thanks..." You say softly as you stand from the table and begin walking around the house to return to Sharon's or rather your car. "I can't thank you enough for this. If you need anything let me know O.K?" She assures to you her good intentions and while you're thankful, you still don't believe you're really doing this. "Thanks." You reply but she seems disappointed. "I know I was rude but I've always wanted to be friends with you. I'd like it if we could be." She informs you after taking a firm stance in front of you. You are actually a bit happy about hearing that. Being a sucker for friendship, you smile and nod in agreement. "I'd like that too, Sharon." You reply but it's taken in once more with disappointment and with a pleading smile and gentle cupping of her cheeks, Sharon asks... "Can you please call me Victoria?"

You're hesitant to appease such a request but in the end concede, if not only so you can leave and gather yourself together. "Alright. Well, I'll see you at school tomorrow, V--Victoria..." You say and rush to your car but sadly catch a glimpse of her satisfied smile before turning around. "Bye Sharon!" She hollers and as you turn out of the driveway, you can see her waving, still bright eyed. You sigh and smack yourself in the head, disgusted with how opposite that went. You were supposed to walk out of there with your body but instead almost said to her face that she could keep your body for good.

Depressed with your confrontation skills you...

1242212211221221112212111112221222222111.content:
You went to your former home to tell Victoria that you wanted to swap
back, that you wanted your body back.

Instead, what happened seemed surreal to you : you talked, then realized
that the person formerly known as Sharon Winterly really wanted your body
and life A LOT more than you did. When it dawned on you that maybe she'd
really be better off living your life, you couldn't say no to her and ended up
trading useful information with her...well, technically, you ended up receiving
most of the information, since Sharon stalked her way into knowing almost
every there is to know about Victoria Wilson.

Strange, the simple act of thinking about this name now seemed foreign to you.
Sharon Winterly : that's who you now were. Since you still had the power, you
could always swap back, but you didn't even want it right now. Hell, she had said
it best when you talked about it : she was richer, prettier, and more popular than you
were as Victoria. The only thing you'd miss would be your family and friends, but
befriending the new Victoria would allow you to keep them relatively close if you
wanted...

You opted to go to Betty's house to talk to her about it, then a strange idea came to
your mind : as far as she knew, you were wondering about swapping back, so you
could let her believe that you were the real Sharon Winterly. That could give Victoria
the "full experience" that she wanted, while allowing you a 100% fresh start. You could
even tell her that this swap had changed you and that you wanted to make peace with her,
while still pretending to be Sharon.

On the other hand, you could also play it safe and tell her what happened, even if you know
she'd probably disapprove...or offer some input on this situation.

Still toying with these ideas on your mind, you ring Betty's bell and, after a few seconds,
are greeted by a familiar short-haired brunette, who wears a puzzled expression on her face,
then quickly asks you :

"Victoria? Is that you"

1242212211221221112212111112221222222111.title: Go to Betty's home.

1242212211221221112212111112221222222111.content:
"Yeah, I'm still in Sharon's body." You affirm for Betty after coming to the conclusion that you do not want to lose what little remnants of your life that you have. You can't imagine losing all of your history with Betty and instead being seen by her as someone who was unusually cruel to her. You may have given Sharon more time in your body but you are definitely not giving her your best friend.

She appears rather expectant of the confirmation; nodding profusely while wearing an inelegant smirk. "I thought you were going to swap back?" She says more as a reminder than a question calling for more information. Regardless, you open your mouth to answer but then cease as Betty guides you into her home and towards her room. You pass by her mother, introducing yourself very briefly but surely long enough to remind you of your predicament.

Inside her room while looking rather pathetic at the edge of her bed, you explain to Betty just how incompetent you are. A small chuckle is her only guidance-- as well as a small rubbing of your back. "Well, you were never good at saying no to anyone. Do you really think she enjoys being you more than you do, that's sort of messed up?" Asks Betty but you are no more prepared for that question now than you were several minutes ago. Drought in your expression, you step up from her bed and make a line towards the mirror on the dresser. You sigh as you gently push away some of the bangs that cover your forehead but they fall right back into place. "I don't know. She says she feels perfect which is more than I can say about my life and body-- I mean I love being myself. Certainly more than being Sharon, I just can't look in the mirror now and think of this as myself. Sharon's gorgeous but this face... it's just not mine and I can't think of it as if it is." You ramble your thoughts as they come to you, plainly and directly without hesitation of your rejection towards being Sharon.

"That sounds like something that might go away over time but... if you feel that bad, you have no choice but to swap back." She says and it does make you think. Perhaps you will eventually think of this appearance as your own if you stay like this long enough but as you look at Betty, you can't help but feel you would rather be her than Sharon. At the very least you felt more at peace and with some regret, you pop the question to Betty. "Do you want to be Sharon instead?"
1242212211221221112212111112221222222111.title: "Yeah, i'm still in Sharon's body.&...

1242212211221221112212111112221222222111.content:
Betty nods eagerly to your question. Somehow you knew she would answer this but you are not sure why. "Why actually?"

"Why? Because of my life here with my parents." Betty falls angry on her bed. "The only thing my mother does is watching TV, while every morning my little brother pulls a prank on me." Betty stares at the ceiling ash she continues: "I guess I don't want this boring usual life anymore, I want something exciting."

"But I don't think Sharon has a family at all, she has all these expensive clothes," you look down at your scoopneck shirt which is from a famous brand, "but they aren't around that often to support her as much as your parents do. When you need them." You add.

"I don't care, I just want to be Sharon, I feel like she's the one I suppose to be." Betty stomps her pillow. You're shocked to hear Betty telling you this. It's just like Sharon told you when she wanted to stay. Were you the only one who wasn't happy with being somebody else? Were you too picky perhaps not to enjoy somebody's life.

You saw Becky lying on her bed, staring at you, trying to do the sad puppy look. You just sighted and lied on her bed. You then focus on switching bodies with Betty, for a second you didn't notice anything but then you stare next to you. Sharon's body was staring at you shocked for one second and then her expression changed to a happy face. "You did it, you really did it. Come give me a hug." You felt yourself being squashed down by Betty, or rather Sharon's body. "Thank you so much." She hugged you tightly. You felt how Sharon's chest was hugging your tinier chest. Betty noticed it to as she lets you go and looks at the mirror in her room. You stand next to her, looking at yourself in Betty's body. You were not sure if you were happier being Betty but it felt more natural than being Sharon.

After checking herself out, Betty felt a bit nervous. "I-I think I will go "home" now." She told you.

"I guess you have to. Want to hang out tomorrow?" You ask her.

Betty was hesitating a little, you could see. "I'm not sure, I mean I would love to, but I want some time to get a grip on my life."

You were a little bit sad to hear about that, you hoped Betty could help you out with some things about her life. "Sure," you answer smiling,"I understand."

Betty notices your reaction and hugs you, "Don't worry we can still text each other", she then lets go, "and besides you have a lot of catching up to do with Victoria Betty." You almost forgot about Sharon having your body, you wonder how it would go between you and Sharon.

"I'll call you tonight, see ya." Betty waves you goodbye. You wave too, you watch through the window how Betty steps inside her car and drives off.

You were alone again, not a surprise anymore. You try to think about something else, you have to take over Betty's life, at least for a while. You could check out her Facebook, she had some other friends than you. But you could also try to call Sharon in your body, see if she can 'pretends' to be you or at least act like you.

And one other thing, I've decided to go for the cheerleaders.

"Yes way! I'm so excited." Sharon announces happily.

1242212211221221112212111112221222222111.content:
You're immensely disappointed as Betty shakes her head and with a little spunk you quiz her on why as she seemed eager about it yesterday. She shrugs while rubbing the back of her neck. "I wouldn't mind swapping in a few days for a few hours but being Sharon permanently? No thanks." She deems and while you are sure she is finished, you are proven wrong as she crouches down beside her bed and pulls out a silver case from under it, something you recognize as the container Sharon gave to you as payment. "Besides... one of the perks to being Sharon was being rich but we're pretty wealthy now ourselves." Betty says with a sly grin as she holds up one of the wades of money.

You sigh but end up chuckling loosely from Betty's giddy expression but in denial of being happy about anything right now you plummet yourself face first into the bed, smothering your laughter. The discomfort from lying belly first is only more prominent as you lay atop Sharon's even heftier breasts. You promptly roll over to relieve the ache, finding Betty standing above you looking curiously down at you. "By the way, did you ask Sharon about how she got this much money from her parents?" She asks and it is something you do want to know yourself, especially since if she got it without permission it could be a huge problem for you right now. "No...but I'll find out." You say as you pull out Sharon's phone and dial your number.

"Hello?" You hear over the line, still retaining the gleeful chirp that Sharon left you with.

"Hey Sharon, it's Victori-- well, you probably guessed that. Anyways I w---" You greet her as natural but as before, Sharon is not appeased and refuses to continue any conversation until you 'correct' yourself. You sigh and repeat using the words she wants to hear... "Hello Victoria... it's Sharon." Sharon beams a satisfied "Thank you" while Betty struggles to hold back her laughter from the sidelines. You toss Betty a quick glare before returning to what you wished to ask. "I was wondering how you got all that money. I know you're rich but... getting that much from your parents is just... too much."

"Oh, that. Don't worry about that. How to explain... when I was born my parents put ten million dollars in an account for all my life expenses. When I turned sixteen they gave me complete access to the account-- I wrote it down on that paper, it's yours now. So yeah, college funds, housing and stuff like that. My pa-- your parents aren't going to help you financially if you use all of that money so don't waste it." She explains it to you but you can't help but feel it's a bizarre move by their parents to give their daughter complete use of that much money. Clearly they are way too rich for their own good. "That it? Dinner is ready so I hope so." She asks suddenly.

"Yeah, thanks. Bye." You respond.

"Bye Sharon, see you tomorrow." She says her farewells and you wonder if perhaps in a couple weeks, people calling you Sharon won't leave your heart skipping a beat. "So?" Betty leans forward, morbid with curiosity, tilting her head cutely. "Her parents gave her complete access to an account with ten million dollars in it when she turned sixteen." You relieve Betty of her curiosity, leaving her in a similar state to yourself; utterly blown away by Sharon's parents for giving a teenager access to that much money. Following that interest, you pull the sheet of paper out of Sharon's purse, finding the account number clearly written. The random paper snags Betty's attention instantly as she buzzes "What's that?"

"It's a bunch of information about Sharon, that account number is on here." You tell her and with an eager hand she snags it out of your own, quite close to leaving you with a nasty paper cut. "Hey!" You shout but she is far too enveloped in the sheet to pay you any heed. "34D..." Betty whispers, bringing her eyes up from the paper to stare at your breasts. "This sheet almost makes me want to swap but after seeing how uncomfortable you are, I think I'll stick with my own body." She declares with a smile. A bit irked by her, you take the sheet from her hand and shove it back into Sharon's purse, spouting "Thanks" in quite a sarcastic tone.

"Aw come on, I was just jok---" She begins to say but her mother's voice soon takes over as it echoes through the house. "Betty! Dinner!" The echo ends and Betty eagerly takes herself out of the room, leaving only "Great, I'm starving" in her wake. You let out a long sigh, pick of Sharon's purse and head out of Betty's home, passing by her family for a brief farewell. "I'm sort of hungry too..." You mumble as you seat yourself in Sharon's car, a hand resting gently over Sharon's firm belly.

With no more distractions to persuade you from returning to Sharon's home you eventually head off to it, getting somewhat lost along the way. You are impressed the second time around as you feel miniaturized from the building's size as if it could crush you just from entering. Immediately after entering, a young butler is motioning you towards what you believe is the dining room. "Great timing, miss. Dinner is waiting for you when you're ready." He tells you and with peer pressure and hunger guiding you, you follow him step for step. Your nerves ramble beneath your skin as you take a look at the long elegant table, Sharon's mother present as well as her father or so you assume. "You're late." The supposed father says as you take a seat randomly. He is notably handsome and quite muscular for a man who is probably older than he looks but you only assume that because his hair has grayed. You would be lying if you said you didn't find older men attractive and this man definitely is making your heart beat a little faster-- of course that could just be stress. "Sorry. I was at a friends and lost track of time." You say.

"You look so tense, sweetie. What's wrong?" A gorgeous lady asks, who you know is Sharon's mom just by the soft expressions she is making. Her dark eyes gaze deep into you, a typical gaze from a mother, one designed to inspect their child for flaws and signs of issues. "I'm just a little sick but I'm sure after dinner I'll feel fine." The lie broods a face from the woman that easily shows she doesn't believe you, as mother's often do not. "Really? Alright then." She says with little sincerity as she tilts her head away, brushing her long shimmering black hair before taking up a fork and knife.

The grinding of metal against metal catches your senses as you turn to another person who is uncovering what appears to be your meal. It's something you're not a particular fan of but you do remember it being on Sharon's list of favorite foods. "Thanks." You say kindly towards the man, who bows his head with a smile before walking off. You are surprised when you find yourself completely infatuated with the food, it's taste so much more alluring than it used to be. The cooks are either really good or perhaps some foods taste a bit different now that you're Sharon. You didn't notice anything while you were Betty but perhaps cafeteria food is bad no matter who you are.

--

You allude the parental figures after dinner, an easy task in such a big home. There is plenty of things to grab you attention and curiosity inside Sharon's large room but in the end you do her homework and spend the rest of the night reviewing the information about her class schedule and things related to it.

You drift to sleep eventually but not after hours of wandering thoughts and concerns...

"Oh, miss, you got up yourself this morning?" She asks you with a smile which seems somewhat forced. "Yes." You reply bluntly, not having much else to say. "What would you like this morning?" She asks afterward. You assume she is asking about food but not wanting to be picky or overall abusive of the caretaker, you say... "Anything is fine." She nods and let's you go on your way and into a bathroom that is larger than your bedroom.

"This is so unnecessary." You comment as you go about your business while relishing the sheer size and quality of the restroom. The Jacuzzi is beyond tempting as you have never been in one before but you instead opt for the shower built for seven. You remove your clothing with hesitance, not wanting to see Sharon naked despite being curious but also a bit disgusted. You are by no means homophobic but you do feel it's natural to be embarrassed about seeing anyone else naked. Considering the circumstances you finally take a peek at yourself in the mirror. You are a bit dazzled by how beautiful Sharon's body is, her tanned skin such a different variety from your milky white. Her curves are flawless and as you take a look down at yourself, your stomach begins to curl; with no clothing to hide it any longer, you come to a strange understanding of the situation. It's clear you are now someone else as you look down at your bare body, completely different in shape, size and color. Oddly enough, you find the first person gaze from atop Sharon's ample body a far more surprising and gut wrenching guilt express than seeing someone else's face in the mirror. "It's strange..." you whisper but finally remember that the water has been running in the shower for a good three minutes now.

You leave the bathroom with towels wrapped tightly around your head and chest and make your way towards Sharon's bedroom. You could spend days exploring her vast closet but opt for something a little less revealing from yesterday's outfit and perhaps a bit more you; a pair of jeans and a simple green T-shirt, both still doing quite a job of showing the curves of Sharon's body. "Betty" going blank for a second, then looking at you, then herself, in disbelief.

She grabbed her new "moderate" assets, which clearly seemed to feel different from the
ample bosom the real Grace exhibited.

The new Betty grabbed your arm and said :

"Sharon ? Sharon, I think you won't believe me, but I'm not Betty, I'm really..."

But before she could even finish her sentence, a loud shriek seemed to come from the women's
restroom nearby. A couple of seconds later, "Grace" could be seen exiting from them, and she
seemed...

1242212211221221112212111112221222222111.content:
Before you can even form an impression of awe from how quickly Grace deciphered both what has happened to her and who she is merely by a simple examination of her body, your attention shifts to Betty who graces the entrance of the cafeteria with her head held down, still captivated by her new body. But as her head raises and her hand whisks away the long dark hair from her face, you now see the anger upon her new face; her lower lip pressing up and her small nose furling just as the former Grace's would. You fall into your shoulders as she walks towards you, seemingly unabated by the mute Grace who sits staring with a jaw hung by an anchor weighing more than the chair she sat upon.

Your gaze falls to the cafeteria floor in a pray to evade the confrontation but soon the feet of the girl come into your few, the tapping white toes which peer out from her sandals a sign of her disapproval. You raise your head to meet her, your heart crafting a new rhythm as you see her face which seems to pierce your nerves far more than Betty's ever would-- clearly Grace's face was accustomed to anger. "What th--" She begins to ask something but before she can even test your whim, Grace interrupts with similar words... "What the... fuck? Give me my body back right this instant!" She demands with a hand planting itself firmly onto the table. Yet again, you find it impressive how swiftly she figures out her predicament, it took you a trip to the bathroom and a mirror to figure it out your first time.

Betty arches her neck around to confront the imposter, saying simply... "What are you talking about? If you don't mind, I need to talk to Sharon in private." Grace doesn't appear to know what to say and neither do you. Though she has no words in mind to say, Grace doesn't leave her seat to provide the privacy Betty desires so instead you feel yourself being ripped from your seat so fast that the feel of Betty's firm grip doesn't even register in your mind until after you're out of the cafeteria. "Do you mind explaining to me why I'm in Grace's body?" She asks as she releases your arm and swivels upon her heel to meet eyes with you. You can tell by the ridges of her jaw which pulse with the continual clenching of her teeth that she is far more angry than she sounds and is probably refraining from cursing simply because it's you; her best friend.

Your mouth opens but words fail you as tears begin to well up in your eyes. Your life is slipping away from you and now you just made your best friend furious with you. "I just..." You begin as you rub away the tears before they expel from their ducts but before you can even grasp at what it is you want to say next you feel a flick upon your forehead. You rub away the sting quickly but a glance at the culprit reveals a much softer expression than before. "Calm down. Gosh, you're so emotional. Now just tell me why." She says with a long sigh as she calmly places a hand upon her accentuated hip. You smile briefly and nod obediently, thinking continuously in your head about how much you love Betty. "Right, I was just... a bit scared of losing you as a friend. You said you couldn't really tell the difference between Sharon and me and that you have to 'fake' hate me for now. I'm sorry, I just wanted things to be normal again or as close to it as possible so I sort of-- without thinking... swapped you with Grace so you could be my friend again." You explain sounding increasingly pathetic as the tears swell up again. Any anger Betty may wish to put upon you is long lost as your hands cover up your tearing eyes yet again and with a long sigh she pats your shoulder, consoling you merely on habit... "Right, right, I get it."

You merely stare at her with a delightful smile, pleased to know she understands your emotions the same way as she always has. You're about to ask her if she actually wants to stay as Grace for your selfish benefit but before you can, you hear Sharon whine from behind you... "Did you do something? Betty is telling me she is... you." She asks as she turns to Betty to finish her question. You tell her why you did it which leaves her disoriented on whether or not she is fine with it herself. You know it may ruin her 'immersion' as 'Victoria.'

Eventually she says...

back."

You can quickly see the fear of losing her new dream body in her eyes, and sadly, it
